isis.stitle: RECONDITIONING ROTORS - INSPECTION - PARALLELISM OR VARIATION IN THICKNESS

svcproc.title: PARALLELISM OR VARIATION IN THICKNESS
svcproc.para:
Rotors should be inspected for parallelism. Parallelism refers to the amount of variation in thickness of the rotor ( Figure 13
).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Rotor Parallelism or Variation Thickness

svcproc.para: Excessive variation can cause pedal vibration or fight, front end vibrations and possible "grab" during the braking action--a condition comparable to an out-of-round brake drum.

The thickness variation or parallelism check on the rotor may be done at the same time as the lateral runout check. Use a micrometer to check the variation in thickness of the rotor at four equally spaced points around the rotor ( Figure 14
).
If the thickness varies more than .002 inch (.0508 mm), re-facing of the rotor will be required. Replace the rotor if not trued up before the minimum allowable thickness is obtained.
